attributes.action: Remove requirement for ‘Day 2 Test’ after travel for fully vaccinated passengers
attributes.additional_details: Fully vaccinated passengers on flights are far less likely to catch and spread COVID, therefore they should be exempt from isolation if someone on their plane tests positive.
attributes.background: Whole flights of passengers are being unnecessarily ‘pinged’ because someone on their flight has tested positive for COVID after arriving in the UK, is this necessary when a mandatory test is already taken before the flight?

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action:

Exempt vaccinated people from PCR test requirement when travelling to England
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/586189
